message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product. Given its value, I'm initially proposing a price of $22,000. I believe this reflects its worth and the benefits it will bring you.
I appreciate the value you see in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $18,000. I'm willing to pay that price, but I think it's a bit more reasonable given the market value.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. While $18,000 is a tempting offer, I believe the true value of this product is significantly higher.  How about we meet in the middle at $20,000? This price reflects the value it brings while acknowledging your interest.

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $17,500 for the product. I think this is a fair price that reflects the value I see in it, and I'm hoping we can meet at this price.

Bob, I understand your position, but I'm still confident that this product is worth more than your offer. To be fair, I'm willing to come down slightly to $19,000. This is my final offer, and I believe it's a very competitive price for the value you're getting.
I appreciate your flexibility, but $19,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $17,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price, and I'm hoping we can meet at this price.

Bob, we're getting close, but I need you to understand the value of this product. $17,000 is too low for what it offers. I'm willing to make one last concession at $18,500.  This is my absolute bottom line.

I understand that you're trying to get the best price, but $18,500 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to pay $16,500 for the product. I think this is a fair price, and I'm hoping we can meet at this price.
